name: Tomasz Grotkowski
role: Artistic Advisor and Program Concept Curator
bio: Tomasz Grotkowski has been active in the music market since 1995 as a DJ holding professional qualifications issued by the Polish Association of Music Presenters in Warsaw. For years he has been actively involved in creating social and cultural events. He was the founder and President of the PACA Association in Peterborough. Journalist, publisher and radio presenter for 6 years associated with Polish Radio London. In his work he uses educational competences â€“ he is an instructor and author of DJ workshops for seniors in Szczecin. As co-organizer of concerts at Willa Lentza, he contributed to the realization of events with artists such as Xantone Blacq and Emma Rawicz. In 2024, he contributed to the "Niewidzialni" program, collaborating with Program III of Polish Radio. At Lux Artis Foundation, he is responsible for the music program and event coordination. He ensures the artistic quality of implemented projects, supports the planning process and develops program concepts that strengthen the foundation's activities and give it a coherent identity. His experience in the music and media industry brings professionalism, stability and practical knowledge needed to conduct artistic and social projects to the team.
